title: Thema Relationships - hv12
description: Dit thema valt onder de arrangeerbare leerlijn van de Stercollecties voor Engels voor havo en vwo, leerjaar 1 en 2. Dit is thema 12 'Relationships'. Het thema omvat de volgende onderwerpen: Friendship, Love letters, In and out of love en Conflicts. De grammaticaopdrachten gaan over imperative, gerund, live, lives and life en eindigd met een grammaticatoets.

items.content:
Welcome to the twelfth theme of English.
This theme is about Relationships.

How?
By listening, reading, speaking and writing.

What?
You are going to visit websites. You are going to play games and practice.
You read, write and listen to people who talk about friendship, love and conflicts.

By practicing a lot your English will improve!


Have fun!

You have just started the theme Relationships.
You will find different things to watch, to listen to, to read and of course to do.
There are videos, recordings, pictures, photos, texts and exercises.
There are different types of exercises. Some of them you have to do on your own, others you are doing in a group.

At the end of those group exercises you are going to discuss the answers in your group. Some exercises will be checked by the computer.
First, do the test to check what you already know.

content.body:
Can you drag the English words on the right hand-side to the correct sentences?

1. My boyfriend and I each other.

2. Lucy has a on James.

3. His meant a lot.

4. Maintaining a friendship takes time and .

5. For our first date he arranged a picnic.

6. I'm really glad you are my best .

7. Alex and Gloria got into an .

items.content:
In this theme you will focus on the following 'can do' statements.

Luisteren

  • You can understand simple sentences about the theme Relationships when people talk slowly and clearly.

Lezen

  • You understand simple sentences in a simple story about friendship, love and conflicts.

Gesprekken voeren

  • You can take part in a simple conversation about friendship, love and conflicts. The person you are speaking to speaks slowly and sometimes repeats sentences. They also help you to formulate what you are trying to say.
  • You can ask and answer simple questions about the theme Relationships.

Spreken

  • You can use simple expressions and sentences to talk about Relationships.

Schrijven

  • You can write a short, simple letter or an email. In doing so, you use words that have to do with the theme Relationships.

In this theme you are going to do the following things:

  • Listen to people who are talking about friendship.
  • Read and write about love letters, dating, love and conflicts.
  • Have a conversation about love and breaking up a relationship.

But you don't have to be able to do this right away!
If you take the following steps (lessons) you'll find out what you need to know!

Lesson

Title

Activities

1

Friendship

Watch a video about friends.
Read a text, speak and write about friendship.
Grammar: Practise with the imperative.

2

Love letters

Listen to a speak about love letters.
Read and write a love letter.
Grammar: Practise with the gerund.

3

In and out of love

Listen to a song about a break up.
Read and write about dating and talk about ending a relationship.
Grammar: practise with live, lives and life.

4

Conflicts

Listen and read about resolving a conflict.
Talk and write about arguments and conflicts.
Grammar: do a 'grammar test'.

Hieronder vind je de vier blokken die horen bij dit thema.
Maak je keuze.

Blok 1

Friendship
Blok 2

Love letters
Blok 3

In and out of love
Blok 4

Conflicts

Vocabulary Relations

These words and chunks can help you with the lessons. You don't need to learn them by heart.
Deze woorden en chunks kunnen je helpen bij je lessen. Je hoeft ze niet uit je hoofd te leren.

Vocabularylist Relations A Relations chunks A
Vocabularylist Relations B Relations chunks B
Vocabularylist Relations C

Tip:

There are many ways to study vocabulary. You can read the words aloud or copy them.
Click in Wozzol on the red arrow for the options.
Er zijn veel manieren om te werken aan je woordenschat. Je kunt de woorden hardop uitspreken of kopiëren.
Klik in Wozzol op de rode pijl voor de verschillende opties.

Je hebt de blokken van het thema 'Relationships' doorgewerkt.
Tijd voor de Finishing touch.
Je vindt hier drie extra opdrachten.
Werk samen met een groep klasgenoten.
Maak daarna de D-toets en beantwoord de evaluatievragen.

Succes.

Celebrity matchmaker
Gesprekken voeren; een e-mail schrijven

Situation:
Six famous people are bored with their love life and are looking for other celebrities to go on a date with.
All six have contacted a celebrity matchmaker and the six of them had to fill out a list with four questions about themselves (physical appearance, age, I like and I hate).

Task:

  • Work together with six classmates.
  • Download the worksheet Celebrity matchmaker and cut out the celebrity cards.
  • Give one celebrity card to each member of your group.
  • Do not show your card to members of your group.
  • From now on you will be the celebrity on your card.
  • You must find another person that likes or hates the same things as you do.

Procedure:

  • Make sure the six of you are close enough to talk to each other and understand each other.
  • Start asking questions to the other celebrities and try to find out who could match your personality. Make sure you talk to all men if you're a woman and vice versa.
  • When you have spoken to the three potential dates, write down who you think your ideal date is.
  • Sit together and tell each other who you think your date is. See if the other person 'likes you too'.
  • Finally, show each other your cards, have a look at them all together and find out if you were right. Use the millionaire matchmaker answer sheet if necessary.

After the dating process, you need to write an email to your anonymous celebrity matchmaker to tell her who you think would be your ideal date.
Send her an email of about 50 words explaining who you think your ideal date is and why. Tell her how your meeting with this person went too.
Think of an appropriate opening and closing of your email.

You have done a good job if:

  • You've had a conversation with three potential dates.
  • You've successfully found your perfect match.
  • You wrote an email of about 50 words.

I am sorry
Gesprekken voeren; excuses aanbieden

Situation
You regularly call and facetime your English pen pal. You made plans to call last night but you forgot and went to a party. After calling you a few times, your pen pal saw photos and videos of you at the party on social media. Your pen pal then send you the following messages.

I tried to call you a few times, but it seems you are at a party…
To be honest, I'm a bit angry and disappointed.

It's okay if you forgot or if you made other plans, but you could have just texted me or called me back to tell me. It made me feel like I didn't matter to you at all. That sucked…

You decide to call back your pen pal the following morning.

Act out the conversation with a classmate.

  • Work together with a classmate.
  • Together think about what you can say to apologize.
  • Also come up with a reaction from your pen pal.
  • If needed, write down keywords about what you're going to say
  • Decide who is going to be the pen pal and who is going to apologize.

Tip: Ask two classmates to listen to your conversation and give feedback.

You have done a good job if:

  • You started and ended the conversation correctly
  • You knew the correct words
  • You knew how to apologize
  • You spoke clearly
  • Everybody understood you
  • You improved your conversation with a classmate.

heading.content: Project C: I miss you already

items.content:
I miss you already!
Corresponderen; een korte e-mail schrijven

Situation
You just came back from a holiday abroad. When you were on holiday you met someone and fell in love.
Write your holiday love an email of at least ten sentences with the subject "I miss you already!".

Tip: Use a dictionary.
Tip: Ask a classmate to read your email and give you feedback.

You have done a good job if you:

  • wrote at least ten sentences in English.
  • started and ended the email correctly.

You asked a classmate to give you feedback.
Test je kennis. Maak de diagnostische toets.

content.body:
Complete the sentences with the correct words. There are three extra words.
Choose from: adolescence - butterflies - friends - reevaluate - terribly - universe - weak - wreck

  1. Hayley was a after her relationship ended.
  2. is the period between childhood and adulthood.
  3. I only have two close , but that's more than enough for me.
  4. I think we should our strategy. This isn't working.
  5. Noah felt in his stomach when Lily walked by.

Fill in the English translations of the words.

Dutch English
1 situatie
2 vriendschap
3 hecht
4 kortzichtig
5 toekomst

Fill in the Dutch translations of the words. There are three extra words.
Choose from: eerlijkheid - het uitmaken - koppelen - kwetsen - oprecht - opstootje - verliefd zijn - verontschuldiging

English Dutch
1 to break up
2 honesty
3 to have a crush
4 to match
5 altercation

Fill in the Dutch translations of the words.

English Dutch
1 to calm down
2 hardheaded
3 root cause
4 to mediate
5 to phone

prompt.body:
How do you say this in English?

1. Hoe raad je iemand aan het in het openbaar uit te maken?

2. Hoe zeg je dat je niet denkt dat het gaat lukken?

3. Hoe vraag je of iemand met je op date wilt gaan?

4. Hoe zeg je dat je hoopt dat iemand hetzelfde voelt?

5. Hoe zeg je dat vrienden het leven beter maken?

values.value:
1 You should break up in public.

2 I (really) don’t think it’s working out.

3 Would you go out on a date with me?

4 I hope you feel the same way.

5 Friends make our lives (so much) richer and more beautiful.

content.body:
1 You should break up in public.

2 I (really) don't think it's working out.

3 Would you go out on a date with me?

4 I hope you feel the same way.

5 Friends make our lives (so much) richer and more beautiful.

Fill in the correct form of the verb. Use the imperative.

  1. (to stop) running! You are going to fall.
  2. (not - to worry) about us. We will be fine.
  3. Please, (to take) a seat in the waiting room. The doctor will come get you shortly.
  4. (to order) dinner tonight. I don't feel like cooking.
  5. Wait! (not - to forget) to buy eggs and strawberries on your way home.
  6. The weather is beautiful today. (to go) to the beach together.
  7. (not - wait) for me to get home. It is going to be a long night.
  8. (not - run) alongside the pool. That's dangerous.

Complete the sentences with the gerund. Use the given verbs.

  1. My parents love (to play) board games together.
  2. Nick is interested in (to become) a primary school teacher.
  3. (to dive) is forbidden on this side of the pool. The water is too shallow.
  4. Paula is worried about (to fail) the test, even though she studied all week.
  5. The thief confessed to (to steal) the bike.
  6. I enjoy (to swim) in a pool, but not in the sea.
  7. My sister hates (to do) the washing up after dinner.
  8. (to smoke) is not allowed in restaurants anymore.

Fill in the correct word.
Choose from: live - lives - life

  1. Their way of is different from ours.
  2. Would you like to forever?
  3. I hope he lived a long and happy .
  4. Patricia and William on Second Street.
  5. A lot of people lost their lives in the earthquake.
  6. My uncle lives in the house he grew up in.
  7. The best things in are love and friendship.
  8. Where do you ?
  9. All my , I've had this feeling that I would be great at ice-skating.
  10. My dad saves every day. He is a trauma surgeon.

prompt.body:
Read the text and answer the question.

First time in love

Anne: Kate, I have something wonderful to tell you. I'm in love!
Kate: Wow Anne! That's so exciting indeed. Who's the lucky guy?
Anne: His name is Paul and I met him at the tennis club. I had seen him play before and thought he was handsome. But a few weeks ago we started talking and the rest is history.
Kate: Is this your first time being in love?
Anne: Yes, how old were you when you fell in love with your first boyfriend?
Kate: I fell in love for the first time when I was 14. He was a few years older and I thought he was so cool.
Anne: OK, so how did you meet him?
Kate: We met through mutual friends. My friend Desiree introduced me to him. She thought we would hit it off, and we did.
Anne: Where did you go on your first date?
Kate: We went to the cinema. We shared some popcorn and he held my hand during the movie. I thought it was very romantic.
Anne: So, were your parents cool with you having a boyfriend?
Kate: Yes, they really liked him. He often joined us for dinner, so they got to know him very well.
Anne: Are you still in love with him?
Kate: No, unfortunately we broke up a few months ago.


1. Where did Anne meet the boy she's in love with?

Read the text and answer the question.

Anne: Are you still in love with him?
Kate: No, unfortunately we broke up a few months ago.


2. How old was Kate when she first fell in love?

Read the text and answer the question.

4. What did Kate's parents think of her boyfriend?

Read the text and answer the question.

First time in love

Anne: Kate, I have something wonderful to tell you. I'm in love!
Kate: Wow Anne! That's so exciting indeed. Who's the lucky guy?
Anne: His name is Paul and I met him at the tennis club. I had seen him play before and thought he was handsome. But a few weeks ago we started talking and the rest is history.
Kate: Is this your first time being in love?
Anne: Yes, how old were you when you fell in love with your first boyfriend?
Kate: I fell in love for the first time when I was 14. He was a few years older and I thought he was so cool.
Anne: OK, so how did you meet him?
Kate: We met through mutual friends. My friend Desiree introduced me to him. She thought we would hit it off, and we did.
Anne: Where did you go on your first date?
Kate: We went to the cinema. We shared some popcorn and he held my hand during the movie. I thought it was very romantic.
Anne: So, were your parents cool with you having a boyfriend?
Kate: Yes, they really liked him. He often joined us for dinner, so they got to know him very well.
Anne: Are you still in love with him?
Kate: No, unfortunately we broke up a few months ago.


5. Does Kate still have a boyfriend?

You have known your friend for ten years.
Write her a card and propose going out to dinner to celebrate the friendship.

  1. Start your email appropriately.
  2. Explain why you're writing the card.
  3. Write about what you like about your friendship.
  4. Explain your plan to celebrate your friendship.
  5. Propose a date and time to celebrate.
  6. Ask your friend a question.
  7. Finish your email appropriately.

values.value:
Voorbeeldantwoord:

1 My dear friend

2 I am writing you because we have been friends for ten years.

3 I am so happy that we can always be honest with each other. / We always have so much fun together. / You always make me laugh.

4 Voorbeelden: To celebrate this moment / our friendship / the last ten years, I would like to go out to dinner together / with you.

5 Voorbeelden: Are you free on Saturday at 19:00h? / Shall we go out to dinner on Friday at 18:30h?

6 Voorbeelden: What restaurant would you like to go to? / Where would you like to eat?

7 Voorbeelden: Bye for now! / Best wishes. / Speak to you soon.

(your name)

content.body:

1 My dear friend

6 Voorbeelden: What restaurant would you like to go to? / Where would you like to eat?

7 Voorbeelden: Bye for now! / Best wishes. / Speak to you soon.

(your name)

prompt.body:
Read the text and answer the questions.

Friends fight

Last night, I got into a huge fight with my best friend Thom. We were at a party at another friend's house. He wanted to leave, but I didn't because my crush was there too. This was my one chance to talk to her. She was finally paying attention to me when my friend started to pull me towards the door. "Come on Kevin! I want to leave." He said over and over again. I'm not proud of what happened next: I snapped. At first, I just raised my voice, but then he started to shout. We called each other names and said horrible things to each other that we didn't mean. At one point I even pushed him. I can't believe I did that. I really regret it. Luckily, one of our other friends came between us and stopped the fight. Thom left and I felt horrible. I didn't want to fight, I just wanted to stay at the party and impress my crush.

This morning, I called Thom to apologize. He was hurt by all the things I had said in the heat of the moment, but he accepted my apology. I also told him that I should have gone home with him. It turns out that Thom wanted to leave because his ex was at the party with her new boyfriend. He didn't tell me because he was ashamed that he still had feelings for her. So, we came up with a plan. In the future, we will always tell each other the truth, and we will always listen to each other's point of view without getting mad.


1. Why didn't Kevin (the writer) want to go home?

2. Who started the fight?

3. What happened during the fight?

4. Why did Thom want to go home?

5. What are Kevin and Thom going to do in the future to prevent fights from happening?

values.value:
(0,25 p per goed antwoord)

1 The girl he has a crush on was at the party.

2 Kevin

3 They raised their voices, called each other names, and Kevin pushed Thom.

4 His ex was at the party (with her new boyfriend).

5 Be honest with each other/tell each other the truth hand listen to each other without getting mad.

content.body:
(0,25 p per goed antwoord)

1 The girl he has a crush on was at the party.

2 Kevin

3 They raised their voices, called each other names, and Kevin pushed Thom.

4 His ex was at the party (with her new boyfriend).

5 Be honest with each other/tell each other the truth hand listen to each other without getting mad.

items.content:
You started this theme you with a test in the section Need to know.

  • Do this test again.
  • Are your results better than the first time?

At the end of each double period you answered evaluation questions. Use these answers to answer the following questions:

  • What new things did you learn?
  • Which assignment was the best one to learn from?
  • Are you able to do what you have to do?
  • How did you get on doing the assignments?

Timing
In the introduction of each double period there is an indication of the amount of time you need to do the activity.

  • What do you think of this timing?

Group work

  • What do you think of working in a group?
  • Did every group member do the same amount of work?

Projects

  • What did you think of the projects?

Verderkijker

De Verderkijker biedt bij dit thema passende externe linkjes naar uitleg, oefenmateriaal of filmpjes. Voor het thema Relationships zijn de volgende items geselecteerd.

Grammatica - Imperative:

  • https://www.youtube.com/
    Bekijk en oefen Imperative met deze video.
  • http://www.englisch-hilfen.de/
    Invuloefening gebiedende wijs.

Grammatica - Gerund:

  • http://www.better-english.com/
    Oefening: wat is de -ingvorm van deze werkwoorden?
  • http://www.ecenglish.com/
    Uitleg + oefening Gerund-vorm.

Grammatica - Live, life, live?

  • http://www.englisch-hilfen.de/
    Invuloefening met live, life, lived of lives.
  • http://www.tolearnenglish.com/exercises/
    Uitleg en invuloefening.
  • https://de-de.facebook.com/
    Foutief gebruik van 'Life'.

Lezen - Schrijven - Luisteren - Kijken - Spreken:

  • http://www.esl-lab.com/easy/first date
    Luister naar de audio 'First date' en beantwoord de vragen.
  • http://learnenglishteens.britishcouncil.org/
    Bekijk de ansichtkaart uit New York. Schrijf zelf een kaart (en maak gebruik van de tips). Doe de invuloefening: Check your writing.
  • http://www.elllo.org/
    Bekijk de video 'Have you ever been heartbroken?'. Maak de Video Quiz
  • https://www.speaklanguages.com/english/
    Een aantal zinnen over 'Dating and Romance". Klik op de zinnen voor de uitspraak.


In de Verderkijker wordt gebruikgemaakt van beeld- en filmmateriaal dat beschikbaar is op internet. Bij het gebruik zijn we uitgegaan van fair use. Mocht u vragen/opmerkingen hebben, of constateert u een niet-werkende link, horen wij dit natuurlijk graag. Dit kan via onze helpdesk

sections.title: Project C: I miss you already
